alert.note: Alert for Mountains above 5500 feet; Southern Graham-Central and Eastern Cochise-Southern Greenlee-Lower Elevations of the San Carlos Apache Nation in Graham County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 25 at 2:08PM MST until May 27 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND A HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 152 AND 154 BELOW 6000 FEET... The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Saturday morning through Saturday evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 152 And 154 including portions of Cochise, Graham and Greenlee counties. * TIMING... 11 AM MST through 8 PM MST Saturday. * WINDS...Southwest to West Winds at 15-25 mph gusting to 30-40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY... 7-15%. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop or are ongoing will have the potential to spread rapidly. * FOR A DETAILED VIEW OF THE HAZARD AREA...Visit weather.gov/Tucson and click on the Detailed Hazards Icon.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of the Fire Weather Watch for portions of Southeast Arizona.

area.areaDesc: Mountains above 5500 feet; Southern Graham-Central and Eastern Cochise-Southern Greenlee-Lower Elevations of the San Carlos Apache Nation in Graham County
